result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

03/03/16 - Plea & Sentence
Case - Dismissed and read in.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1014 - Matter heard with 16CF162. Parties report a resolution has been reached in both cases. Per plea agreement reached in 16CF162, case is dismissed and read-in. Bond posted in this case or 16CF162 may be applied to costs, balance to be returned to poster.
At the request of ADA Zapf, Motion Hearing rescheduled to 3/2 @ 10am to allow for witness appearances. Attys confirm by e-mail.
At the request of ADA Zapf - Motion Hearing rescheduled from 12/10 to 1/20 @ 10am due to witness unavailability. Parties notified by e-mail.
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Hearing on motion to suppress set for 12/10/15 at 2:00 (1 hour).  Bond continued.

Attorney Hertz-McGrath is requesting 10/1/2015 Motion hearing be rescheduled as she is out sick.  Further proceedings is scheduled for 10/28/2015 at 9:30am.  Motion hearing to be scheduled at the next hearing.  Parties notified via email.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:58pm-  Due to time constraints, Court adjourns motion hearing to October 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:41am-  Due to time constraints, Court adjourns matter to June 25, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  State's witnesses present & confirmed availability in court.  Bond continued.

Today's hearing removed from the calendar as Atty Hertz-McGrath is out ill; matter to be heard with previously scheduled Motion Hearing on 04-02-15 at 11:00 am as Atty Hertz-McGrath's calendar could not accommodate any earlier dates.
to suppress, filed by Atty Hertz-McGrath; to be heard on 04-02-15 at 11:00 am.

Parties jointly request an adjournment of 12/9/2014 Final pre-trial.  Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 1/7/2015 at 10am.  Parties notified in court.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:41am-  Attorney Hertz-McGrath is requesting an adjournment.  Surveillance video provided to her does not work on her computer.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to December 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
